1.rationale:
My snake is close to the apple at (2,1), but the enemy snake is also close to this apple and might get there first if I try to go for it. If I move up, I would go after the apple and if the enemy snake also moves up, I would be able to eat it. However, if the enemy snake goes left, it will eat the apple and I would collide with it and die.

Instead, moving right would be the safer option. Going right would allow me to go for the apple at (4,4) which is relatively unguarded with no enemies nearby. For the next turn, I might want to consider either moving up or continuing right depending in the position of the enemy snake. 

My decided next move: RIGHT.
